definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
decadents (of the Decadent movement of late 19th century Europe)

sentences.chinese: 它很頹廢，並且令人難以置信。

sentences.english: His face was a decadent face.
In time, the foul odor of Roman decadence would grow harder to disguise.
sentences.chinese: 時日一到，羅馬矯飾的頹廢氣味終將難以遮掩。

sentences.english: Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up to enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
sentences.chinese: 歲月悠悠，衰微之及肌膚，熱忱拋卻，頹廢必致靈魂。

sentences.english: Today, we’ll look at some of my favorite unproductivity-day strategies.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我們來看一下我應付頹廢時光的策略。

sentences.english: Tonight I went to classroom for self-study with lower efficiency, resulting from being dispirited for such a long time.
sentences.chinese: 頹廢了那麼久，今天去自修室學習了，但效率比較低。

sentences.english: He resigned and became a recluse, a depressed and beaten man.
sentences.chinese: 他現在已經退休隱居，變成了一個消沉而頹廢的人。

sentences.english: Berlin becamethe decadent capital, where all sorts of sexual deprivations were practised.
sentences.chinese: 柏林成爲頹廢之都，形形色色的性變態行爲都在發生。

sentences.english: He is a member of beat generation .
But what I want to say is:I really appreiciate you.
sentences.chinese: 在我所有的頹廢面前，是你的眼神告訴我不要放棄。

sentences.english: Mad Henry was a hermit who lived alone in a decrepit mansion at the edge of town.
sentences.chinese: 瘋子亨利獨自隱居在市鎮邊緣一處頹廢之所。

sentences.english: I don't want you decadent, emptiness, confusion, botch oneself, hurt others.
sentences.chinese: 我不要你頹廢，空虛，迷茫，糟踐自己，傷害別人。

sentences.english: Don't decadent, emptiness, confusion, upon yourself, hurt others.
sentences.chinese: 不要頹廢，空虛，迷茫，糟踐自己，傷害別人。

sentences.english: Tamsin is rich, spoilt and trying to live a life of seductive decadence.
sentences.chinese: 塔姆西是個有錢人，過着放縱而頹廢的生活。

sentences.english: When self-Tang Li and Du returning, decadent literature, no longer only a.
sentences.chinese: 自唐時李杜歸去，頹廢文壇，再無纔出。

sentences.english: In this decadent city, living in a rattrap.
sentences.chinese: 這座頹廢的城市，生活在這破敗的陋室裏。

definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
confident and at ease/free and easy
to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
